TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {140384=Returns the value of the flexfield MY_DATASTORE_FIELD, for the object instance of type datastore (Internal ID for datastores is 2400), with the internal ID 32001.}
textBeforeTable: Here are some examples of call to getDataType: datetime double Text(%L) Microsoft Access datetime numeric(%L,%P) varchar(%L) Microsoft SQL Server date number(%L,%P) varchar2(%L) Oracle Date Numeric Varchar Technology Given the following syntax for these technologies: Examples Returns the syntax to the target data type date DEST_DATE Returns the syntax to the target data type numeric DEST_NUMERIC Returns the syntax to the target data type varchar DEST_VARCHAR Returns the syntax to the source data type date SRC_DATE Returns the syntax to the source data type numeric SRC_NUMERIC Returns the syntax to the source data type varchar SRC_VARCHAR
textAfterTable: A.2.13 getFilter() Method Use to return the entire WHERE clause section generated for the filters of an interface. Usage  public java.lang.String getFilter(java.lang.Int pDSIndex) Description Returns the SQL filters sequence (on the source while loading, on the staging area while integrating) for a given dataset. In IKMs only, In IKMs only, the pDSIndex parameter identifies which of the datasets is taken into account by this command. Note: The pDSIndex parameter can be omitted when this method is used in an LKM. It can be also omitted for IKMs. In this case, the dataset taken into account is the first one. Parameters Parameter Type Description pDSIndex Int Index identifying which of the datasets is taken into account by this command. None Examples  insert into <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%> select <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[EXPRESSION]", ", ", "", "INS=1")%> from <%=odiRef.getFrom()%> where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJoin()%> <%=odiRef.getFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy()%> <%=odiRef.getHaving()%> A.2.14 getFilterList() Method Use to return properties for each filter of an
